text: Fabia Trabaldo (born 5 March 1972 in Borgosesia, Vercelli) is a retired Italian middle distance runner who specialized in the 800 and 1500 metres. ==Biography== She won one medal, at senior level, at the International athletics competitions. She has 12 caps in national team from 1988 to 1994. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1990 |World Junior Championships |Plovdiv, Bulgaria |7th |800m |2:06.95 |- |rowspan=2|1991 |rowspan=2|European Junior Championships |rowspan=2|Thessaloniki, Greece |bgcolor="silver" align="center" | 2nd |800 m |2:04.75 |- |bgcolor="silver" align="center" | 2nd |1500 m |4:15.78 |- |rowspan=2|1993 |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |align="center" | 8th |1500 m |4:08.23 |- |Mediterranean Games |Narbonne, France |bgcolor="silver" align="center" | 2nd |800 m |2:04.05 |- |1994 |European Indoor Championships |Paris, France |align="center" | 9th |1500 m |4:18.12 |} ==National championships== Fabia Trabaldo has won 4 times the individual national championship. *1 win in the 800 metres (1991) *3 wins in the 1500 metres (1991, 1992, 1993) ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Italian female middle- distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Italy Category:Mediterranean Games silver medalists for Italy Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1993 Mediterranean Games Category:World Athletics Championships athletes for Italy Category:Mediterranean Games medalists in athletics
title: Fabia Trabaldo
